org.modelio.api.module.commands

Class ElementCreationStandardHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.module.commands.DefaultModuleCommandHandler
      • org.modelio.api.module.commands.ElementCreationStandardHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModuleCommandHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiagramCreationStandardHandler

    public class ElementCreationStandardHandler
extends DefaultModuleCommandHandler
    Generic model element creation command handler.

    This handler supports the following parameters;

    • name : the handler identifier
    • metaclass : the metaclass name
    • stereotype : the stereotype name. May be a regular expression. May be "module#stereotype" where module and stereotype are plain text or regular expression. "#" must not be used in the module or stereotype name.
    • relation : the meta relation name from the owner to the new element.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                            IModule module)
        Description copied from interface: IModuleCommandHandler
        Method invoked when the command is launched.

        This command is launched by Modelio when the user clicks on the contextual menu command. The selected elements that corresponds to the current selection are given as parameter.

        The module that is passed as parameter corresponds to the owner of the command.

        Parameters:
        selectedElements - Current selection
        module - Owner of the command

      • accept

        public boolean accept(List<MObject> selectedElements,
                      IModule module)
        Description copied from class: DefaultModuleCommandHandler
        The handler accepts elements matching the scopes
        Specified by:
        accept in interface IModuleCommandHandler
        Overrides:
        accept in class DefaultModuleCommandHandler
        Parameters:
        selectedElements - Current selection
        module - Owner of the command
        Returns:
        true if the command is valid for all the elements, false otherwise.

      • postConfigureElement

        protected void postConfigureElement(Element newElement,
                                    IModule module)
        Hook called once the element is created and configured and before the transaction is committed.

        does nothing by default. Sub classes may redefine this method to make additional modifications.

        Parameters:
        newElement - the new created element
        module - the module
